body:
### Problem

I have the `omnisharp_mono` LSP installed for C# development (via Mason), and its been working great for the past number of months. I stepped away from C# for a few weeks, and when I returned I was unable to open `.cs` files without neovim freaking out:
```
Error executing callback:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
...nvim-linux-x86_64/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/rpc.lua:195: cannot resume dead coroutine                                                                                                                                                                                     
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
        [C]: in function 'parse_chunk'                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
        ...nvim-linux-x86_64/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/rpc.lua:195: in function 'handler'                                                                                                                                                                                    
        ...nvim-linux-x86_64/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:172: in function <...nvim-linux-x86_64/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:171>
```
I would hit enter, and the error message would just reappear, again and again. It wouldn't actually let me edit the file as I couldn't get past it. I disabled `omnisharp_mono` and the issue went away. So, I thought that was the culprit. Except, Omnisharp hasn't had an update since Dec. 2024, which is before the problem started. So I decided to mess with my LSP config. I stripped all my Omnisharp customization and configuration away until the only thing I was essentially `ensure_installed = { 'omnisharp_mono' }`, but still no cigar.

I use the nightly build of neovim, and keep it up-to-date (update it roughly once a week?). My final troubleshooting step was to revert back to the latest stable neovim release (v0.11.0). Lo-and-behold, it fixed my issue. I've been running fine on stable ever since, even with all my customization/configs.

I have the latest versions of all packages/language servers, as well as the latest version of Mono installed on my system.
I don't know enough to say what caused it; but some change between the stable release and the nightly build broke my LSP.

### Steps to reproduce

Open a `.cs` file with the `omnisharp_mono` LSP installed on the latest nightly build. Observe errors.
Then, using the exact same LSP setup/config, switch to the stable release, open the same file, and see no errors.

I was able to reproduce it with a blank lspconfig that basically only had `ensure_installed = { 'omnisharp_mono' }` in the Mason section, but if it helps, [here is my current lspconfig](https://github.com/Zman350x/nvim-config/blob/main/lua/zman/plugins/lsp/lspconfig.lua).

### Expected behavior

Able to open/edit a `.cs` file without issue, and with a working LSP.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.12.0-dev-178+gd3cded796c

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

KDE Neon 6.3

### Terminal name/version

konsole 25.04.0

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

other, extracting the `.tag.gz` (either nightly or release) into my `/usr/local/bin`

comment_data.body: Please bisect, and if possible provide a minimal(!) config we can test with `nvim --clean -u test.lua`.
For reference: you are using the legacy `lspconfig["omnisharp_mono"].setup()`, it may be worth trying `vim.lsp.config` instead.

labels.description: waiting for reply from the author
labels.name: needs:response

title: Nightly build breaks C# LSP
